description: Good morning and happy Friday, it’s Georgie here in Sydney with the latest top news for you.Today’s must-reads:• Expectations of a rate rise strengthen• Renewables drive backed by miners, environmentalists• Biden faces intensifying calls to drop out of the race
title: Rate-hike bets grow

description: Canada’s finance minister says the country is on track for a soft landing, with inflation in retreat, interest rates on the way down and no recession in sight.
title: Canada’s Finance Minister Is Upbeat on Economy Amid Carney Reports

description: Brazil will freeze 15 billion reais ($2.7 billion) in spending from this year’s budget to comply with its fiscal target, providing some relief to investors who feared President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva wouldn’t sign off on the measure.
title: Brazil Freezes $2.7 Billion From Budget With Lula’s Blessing

description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced a crackdown on Russia’s so-called shadow fleet of oil tankers used to skirt international sanctions, saying 44 European nations had endorsed the plan at a meeting of the European Political Community hosted in Britain.
title: Europe Agrees New Crackdown on Russian Oil Tanker ‘Shadow Fleet’

description: The FBI was given access to unreleased technology to access the phone of the man identified as the shooter of former President Donald Trump, according to people familiar with the investigation.
title: FBI Used New Cellebrite Software to Crack Trump Shooter’s Phone

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the increasing pressure on President Joe Biden to step aside for a new Democratic nominee. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden’s Circle of Support for Staying in Race Steadily Shrinks

description: Conservatives behind an extensive plan for reshaping the US government known as Project 2025 see it as a resource for the next presidency of Donald Trump, should he succeed in his bid to return to the White House. Democrats are eager to tie Trump to the plan, given that its more controversial proposals could turn off independent voters, yet Trump has distanced himself from the initiative. However, its recommendations echo many of the positions he’s taken in his campaign, and a number of people c
title: Project 2025, Explained: What It Says and What Trump Says About It

description: Donald Trump is inviting supporters in the cryptocurrency industry to a private fund-raising effort in Nashville on July 27, including an asking price of $844,600 for a seat at a round table.
title: Trump Asks $844,600 for Fundraiser Seat at Bitcoin Conference

description: French lawmakers reelected the centrist candidate from Emmanuel Macron’s party to a second term leading the National Assembly in a sign the president’s coalition may be best placed to form a new government after he dissolved the legislature last month.
title: French Lawmakers Reelect Centrist as President of the Parliament

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz defended a planned Lithium deal with Serbia and said that the mining project will not have a negative effect on the region’s environment.
title: Germany’s Scholz Defends Planned Lithium Deal with Serbia

description: A view of the convention floor before the 2024 Republican National Convention at the Fiserv Forum in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. Photographer: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds/AFP/Getty Images
title: Trump Fans at GOP Convention Await His First Public Address Since Attack

description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said his new multi-party administration will prioritize economic growth by tackling structural reform, fixing badly-run municipalities, cutting red tape and ramping up infrastructure investment.
title: Ramaphosa Plan Envisages South Africa Becoming Construction Site

description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul reiterated her support for President Joe Biden’s election campaign, stating she remains committed as long as Biden continues to seek reelection.
title: Hochul Reaffirms Biden Support as Long as He Stays in Race

description: Tunisia kicked off its election season with a wave of arrests targeting rivals and critics of President Kais Saied, stirring fears of a barely-contested vote that would deal a hammer blow to what was once the Arab world’s most progressive democracy.
title: Tunisia Election Season Begins With President’s Rivals Arrested

description: Egypt kept interest rates at an all-time high for a second consecutive meeting, looking to ensure a slowdown in inflation continues after a dramatic currency devaluation.
title: Egypt Holds Record-High Rate to Keep Lid on Slowing Inflation

description: The Republican nominee has vowed to reverse Biden’s EV policies, but other aspects of Trump’s agenda would benefit his billionaire benefactor.
title: Musk’s Trump Wager Sets Up Shield for Tesla, Gains for SpaceX

description: South Africa’s main opposition parties plan to revive a bid to amend the constitution to allow for land to be expropriated without compensation.
title: South African Opposition Lawmakers Revive Land-Expropriation Bid

description: Chile President Gabriel Boric canceled a trip to the Olympic Games this month after a spate of high-profile murders stunned one of Latin America’s safest nations, forcing the government into action.
title: Chile President Gabriel Boric Scraps Olympic Games Visit to Counter Crime Surge

description: Israeli officials are considering transferring control of Gaza’s Rafah border crossing to the European Union and Palestinians, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Israel Considers Letting EU, Palestinians Control Rafah Crossing

description: President Joe Biden is doing “fine” a day after testing positive for Covid-19, an adviser said Thursday. His campaign, not so much.
title: Biden ‘Fine,’ Campaign Insists, as Pressure to Exit Mounts

description: Nigeria plans to more than double the minimum wage, ending months of haggling with labor unions that saw its power grid and busiest airports shut during a workers’ strike.
title: Nigeria Bumps Up Minimum Wage to Help Ease Cost-of-Living Crunch

description: The UK placed sanctions on 11 more oil tankers that are helping Russia to export its supplies to customers, including some that are part of a shadow-fleet.
title: UK Piles More Sanctions on Fleet of Tankers Moving Russian Oil

description: Giorgia Meloni’s lawmakers in Brussels voted against the reappointment of Ursula von der Leyen as the president of the European Commission, highlighting tensions between the Italian prime minister and European Union institutions.
title: Meloni-EU Spat on Show as Her MEPs Oppose New Von Der Leyen Term

description: Weeks of protests by students in Bangladesh demanding the removal of a quota system for government jobs have spiralled into violent clashes with police and counter-protesters, leaving at least 15 people dead and scores injured, according to media reports.
title: What Triggered Deadly Student Protests in Bangladesh?

description: The Czech Republic accused Germany of hoarding gas by slashing the capacity of an export pipeline just as the region grapples with replacing supplies from Russia.
title: Germany Accused of Hoarding Gas Meant to Supply Czech Republic

description: Norway’s prime minister said he doesn’t see any US President pulling its support for Ukraine or abandoning NATO as the defense alliance benefits all its members.
title: Norway Leader Says No US President Wants to Abandon Ukraine

description: The European Central Bank firmly backs the European Union’s push to bring budget policies in indebted nations in line with the region’s fiscal rules, President Christine Lagarde said.
title: Lagarde Says ECB Strongly Backs Discipline on EU Fiscal Rules

description: Blackstone Inc. executive and billionaire Democratic donor Jon Gray said he hopes President Joe Biden weighs the intense physical demands of running the country for another four years.
title: Blackstone’s Gray Hopes Biden Weighs ‘Physical Toll’ of New Term

description: European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos said he hopes the Spanish government will appoint a new central bank chief by September.
title: ECB’s Guindos Hopes Spain Appoints New Governor by September

description: Sales of tax-exempt gold coins by the UK’s Royal Mint Ltd. jumped in the last quarter as investors fretted about potential changes to fiscal policy by an expected new Labour government.
title: UK Gold Coin Sales Jump on Concerns Over Labour’s Fiscal Plans

description: The UK’s messy handling of its European Union exit damaged the country’s international reputation, the British minister responsible for EU relations told Bloomberg as his new Labour government seeks to reset ties with its closest trading partner.
title: UK Image ‘Tarnished’ by Bungled Brexit, Starmer’s EU Chief Says

description: Ukrainian forces withdrew from a strategic position south of the Dnipro River that they held for months, upending military aims to press ahead against Russian forces with a counteroffensive toward the Crimean peninsula.
title: Ukraine Withdraws From Strategic Position in Southern Region

description: Ursula von der Leyen won a second five-year term as president of the European Union executive’s arm, marking a vote for stability at a time when several key European leaders are facing significant political challenges back home.
title: Von der Leyen Reelected to EU Top Job as Bloc Pursues Stability

description: The prospect of a second US presidency for Donald Trump, and what that means for the defense of Ukraine against Russian aggression is hanging over a major gathering of European leaders on the other side of the Atlantic.
title: European Leaders Cast Wary Eye to Trump’s Tepid Ukraine Support

description: A Russian court sentenced a US citizen to 13 years in prison for attempting to sell narcotics, the latest in a series of cases against Americans.
title: Russia Sentences US Citizen to 13 Years in Drug Case, Tass Says

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves warned “difficult decisions” lie ahead as she tries to fix Britain’s public finances, raising the prospect of tax hikes or spending cuts in her first budget in the autumn.
title: Rachel Reeves Warns ‘Difficult Decisions Ahead’ to Fix UK Economy

description: Somalia’s semi-autonomous region of Puntland wants the United Nations to reinstate an arms ban lifted seven months ago, saying easier access to weaponry is fueling clan conflict.
title: Somalia Region Wants UN to Reinstate a 31-Year-Old Arms Embargo

description: Lithuania will exit the international treaty banning cluster munitions, citing worsening security in the region and Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
title: Lithuania to Exit Cluster Munitions Convention, Citing Security

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump Looms Over Starmer’s Big UK Reset With Europe

description: Israel’s parliament passed a resolution expressing formal opposition to the establishment of an independent Palestinian state, warning that it could serve as a base for terrorist groups.
title: Israel’s Parliament Backs Resolution Opposing Palestinian State

description: The UK’s financial watchdog told banks and other lenders they must do more to ensure that parliamentarians, senior public servants and their families aren’t treated unfairly, following concerns that some customers were being denied accounts on the basis of their political views.
title: UK Says Banks Must Improve Treatment of the Politically Exposed

description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — North Korea resumed flying balloons likely carrying trash toward South Korea on Thursday, the South's military said, days after it vowed to respond to what it called new South Korean civilian leafleting activities across the border.
title: North Korea Launches Balloons Likely Carrying Trash Toward South Korea

description: President Joe Biden canceled an additional $1.2 billion in student debt for public servants on Thursday, the latest effort to provide loan relief and deliver on one of his signature initiatives in the midst of a reelection campaign.
title: Biden Forgives $1.2 Billion in Student Loans in Latest Relief

description: Donald Trump is set to address his party Thursday night for the first time since officially becoming its presidential nominee — and surviving an assassination attempt — with a speech aimed at uniting Republicans in his campaign to defeat President Joe Biden.
title: Trump Makes First Speech to GOP Since Shooting: What to Watch

description: Nigerian President Bola Tinubu plans to slap a one-off 50% tax on windfall profits booked by banks on massive currency gains after the naira was devalued last year.
title: Nigeria Mulls One-Time 50% Windfall Tax on Bank Forex Profits

description: President Xi Jinping vowed to make high-quality development the guiding force of the world’s No. 2 economy, as he mapped out his long-term vision to propel China forward as it battles a domestic slowdown and trade tensions with the US.
title: China Vows to Push for High-Quality Development as ‘Top Mission’

description: The European Union’s €392 billion tool to smooth out differences between the poorer and wealthier regions of the 27-member bloc need an overhaul, according to a ZEW report.
title: EU Cohesion Funds Need a Fundamental Revamp, Report Finds

description: Kenya’s police warned anti-government protesters to stay out of the capital, Nairobi, citing a threat to security.
title: Kenya Police Warn Anti-Ruto Protesters to Stay Out of Capital

description: Ukraine plans to adopt a law allowing the government to impose a moratorium on foreign debt payments as the country and its international creditors wrangle over terms for restructuring more than $20 billion in bonds.
title: Ukraine Plans Law Allowing Foreign Debt Payments Suspension

description: South Africa’s government is considering legislative changes to compel pension funds and asset managers to plow money into industrial policy projects, Business Day reported, citing Trade Minister Parks Tau.
title: S. Africa Eyes Pension Funds to Boost Industrialization, BD Says

description: Ursula von der Leyen pledged to maintain the European Union’s climate ambitions, bolster competitiveness and strengthen defense industries as she sought to lock down a second term as head of the bloc’s executive arm.
title: EU’s Von der Leyen Courts Greens in Bid For Second Term

description: South Korea’s top court ruled in favor of a gay couple seeking spousal coverage for national health insurance benefits, in a landmark decision that might pave the way for recognizing same-sex marriage in the country.
title: Top Court Hands South Korean Gay Couple Win on Spouse Status

description: Bangladesh student protest leaders have pushed for a full-day shutdown of transport networks and businesses from Thursday, piling pressure on Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to abolish the government’s job quota system as demonstrations earlier this week turned violent.
title: Bangladesh Faces Nationwide Shutdown as Jobs Protest Escalates

description: Senator JD Vance’s debut speech as the Republican vice presidential nominee was a fiery demonstration of the most powerful assets he offers Donald Trump’s campaign: a stridently populist economic message tailored for key swing states and a symbol of generational change.
title: Trump’s Heir Vance Cements Populism’s Hold on Republican Party

description: Welcome to Washington Edition. Readers of the Balance of Power newsletter are also receiving this special edition. Bloomberg  Businessweek national correspondent Joshua Green outlines what JD Vance’s selection as Donald Trump’s running mate means for the future of the Republican Party. To get Washington Edition going forward, sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Vance Tries on Mantle of Trump’s Populist Heir Apparent

description: Emmanuel Macron is preparing for the possibility of running France with a caretaker government with limited powers for months as he pushes the country into uncharted constitutional territory.
title: Macron’s Caretaker Government Is Digging In for the Long Haul

description: For the first time this year, economists are divided over whether South Africa’s central bank will continue to leave interest rates at a 2009 high or loosen them.
title: South Africa to Hold Rates Before President’s Key Economy Speech

description: Day Three of the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee has wrapped, with Donald Trump set to tomorrow accept his party’s nomination as candidate in November’s presidential election. Here are five key things to know from Wednesday’s events:
title: Five Key Takeaways From Republican Convention as Vance Steps Up

description: Chinese official media have hit back at a newly popular refrain that the slowing economy has entered a period seen as the “garbage time of history,” underscoring authorities’ unease with rising public discontent over President Xi Jinping’s economic agenda.
title: China Moves to Quash Viral Phrase to Describe Economic Malaise

description: President Joe Biden said he’s willing to relinquish power to Vice President Kamala Harris if he wins a second term but is unable to complete it for health reasons — while discounting the likelihood of that scenario.
title: Biden Says Harris Could Take Over Second Term If Health Changed

description: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad has been hospitalized at the National Heart Institute since Monday, according to his office.
title: Malaysia Ex-Premier Mahathir, 99, Hospitalized for Coughing

description: Senator JD Vance in his address to the Republican National Convention will tout Donald Trump’s economic agenda as one that “won’t cater to Wall Street,” offering a stridently populist message — one which secured him a spot on the ticket as the former president’s 2024 running mate.
title: Vance to Assail Wall Street in Populist Appeal to GOP Convention

description: By Communist Party standards, the Cyberspace Administration of China’s rise has been nothing short of breathtaking.
title: Secretive China Agency Backtracks on Aggressive Policies After $1 Trillion Rout

description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau urged Mark Carney to join his Liberal government, the Globe and Mail reported, citing four unidentified people.
title: Trudeau Urged Carney to Join Government, Globe and Mail Says

description: President Joe Biden can’t catch a break.
title: Biden’s Covid Case Delivers Latest Blow to Hard-Luck Campaign

description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer and House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries have warned President Joe Biden that his continued candidacy imperils the Democratic Party’s chances in the November election, according to multiple news reports.
title: Schumer, Jeffries Reportedly Warned Biden Against His Candidacy
